comments:
In M8, I opened a workspace in Java perspective. I closed Java perspective and 
quickly closed the entire workbench. After all windows were closed, in my 
stderr, I received:


java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: java/io/DataInputStream
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.readCategoryTable
(DiskIndex.java:505)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.DiskIndex.addQueryResults
(DiskIndex.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.index.Index.query(Index.java:127)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.matching.TypeDeclarationPattern.queryIn
(TypeDeclarationPattern.java:188)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.pattern.InternalSearchPattern.findIndexMat
ches(InternalSearchPattern.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.PatternSearchJob.search
(PatternSearchJob.java:105)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.PatternSearchJob.execute
(PatternSearchJob.java:62)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.search.processing.JobManager.performConcurrentJob
(JobManager.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.search.SearchEngine.searchAllTypeNames
(SearchEngine.java:848)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.util.AllTypesCache.search
(AllTypesCache.java:496)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.util.AllTypesCache$TypeCacher.doSearchTypes
(AllTypesCache.java:180)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.corext.util.AllTypesCache$TypeCacher.run
(AllTypesCache.java:149)
Jerome, pls double check it is another symptom of bug 52347.

This is different from bug 52347 as this doesn't happen in JDT Core's shut down 
code. It looks like JDT UI is calling us after we've been shut down. 

Moving to JDT UI for comments.

I just decided that the message may have been there before I shut down the 
workbench. 

Some context: I was running on an experimental VM, that probably did
not return enough memory requested by some Java API. So, this message
is likely a side-effect. 

All that said, printStackTrace(System.err) is not a good way to report 
errors in Eclipse. Error log should be used instead.

I have instances of Eclipse 3.0 M8 become very laggy (around after 5 hours),
which force me to restart Eclipse. The only thread not in a wait state at this
time appears to be the 'All Types Caching'. Of course this may simply be
coincedental.

The following dump is from a P3 800Mhz PC, 512Mb memory, running MS-Windows 2000 

"All Types Caching" daemon prio=4 tid=0x0EC793D8 nid=0x530 waiting on condition

Closing since the all types cache is gone.
